Documentation.name: DAF
Documentation.notes: Initial version created on 13-Jan-2016. Added all shapes. Added Icons. Modified Delta to Lowercase (S type symbol) from Upper case (triangle) 3.0.0.M: Added diagram and remaining toolbox profiles. 3.0.0.N: Added all the quick linker for component creation. 3.0.0.O - Added quick linker for existing components and modified icons. 3.0.0.P - updated with views and tool boxes. 3.0.0.Q - updated with Default size and colors 3.0.0.R - Added table, model and physical service and quick linker for the components. 3.0.0.S - Added modified icons and represented them on top right corner. Changed component default representation to custom representation. 3.0.0.T-Updated Quick Linker with self composition to the elements. Linked Value and ValueRef to Class and added it to the MDG Profile. 3.0.0.U - Added scripts for generation of controller class for the use case from package and diagram. 3.0.0.V - removed some types (in rejected package), added missing types and tagged values (User Story, dDeploymentNode, dProgram) 3.0.0.W - Changed the background and foreground color for Business Partner Active to check the output. 3.1 - new revamped 2018 version updated to Sparx 14

Stereotype.name: dAction
Stereotype.notes: A specialized activity.

Stereotype.name: dActivity
Stereotype.notes: A function or work carried out by the business user.

Stereotype.name: dInitiative
Stereotype.notes: An activity carried out by a Business Unit or organization to achieve a particular goal or improve the Maturity of a certain capability.

Tag.name: DetailedDescription
Tag.description: Detailed Description of the initiative.

Tag.name: Impacted Capability
Tag.description: Describes the contribution this work package makes to capability delivery.

Tag.name: RelatedProgram
Tag.description: The Groth Package or program associated to the initiative.

Tag.name: startDate
Tag.description: The start date for the initiative.

Tag.name: finishDate
Tag.description: The finish date of the initiative.

Tag.name: duration
Tag.description: The expected duration of the initiative in Months/ Weeks or Years.

Tag.name: kind
Tag.description: To capture the type of initiative.

Tag.name: purpose
Tag.description: Purpose of the initiative.

Tag.name: rank
Tag.description: The rank of the initiative.

Tag.name: Description
Tag.description: Description for the initiative.

Stereotype.name: dBusinessProcess
Stereotype.notes: A Business Process is a sum of actions that produces a business advantage to the enterprise. It is composed by one or many BusinessUseCases.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the architecture entity.

Tag.name: LastStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Last date that the standard was reviewed.

Tag.name: NextStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Next date for the standard to be reviewed.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the architecture entity.

Tag.name: ProcessCriticality
Tag.description: Criticality of this process to business operations.

Tag.name: ProcessType
Tag.description: Whether this process is supported by IT or is a manual process.

Tag.name: ProcessVolumetrics
Tag.description: Data on frequency of process execution.

Tag.name: RetireDate
Tag.description: Date when the standard was/will be retired.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Tag.name: StandardCreationDate
Tag.description: If the product is a standard, when the standard was created.

Stereotype.name: dBusinessService
Stereotype.notes: A service provided by Business.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization for Business Service.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for Business Service.

Tag.name: LastStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Last date that the standard was reviewed.

Tag.name: NextStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Next date for the standard to be reviewed.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the architecture entity.

Tag.name: RetireDate
Tag.description: Date when the standard was/will be retired.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dApplicationComponent
Stereotype.notes: An encapsulation of application functionality aligned to implementation structure.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization taxonomy for each element.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the element.

Tag.name: LastStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Last review date for the application component.

Tag.name: NextStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Next review date for the application component.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: The owner for the application Component.

Tag.name: RetireDate
Tag.description: The retire date for the Application Component.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: The source for the application component.

Stereotype.name: dLogicalAppComponent
Stereotype.notes: An encapsulation of application functionality that is independent of a particular implementation.

Stereotype.name: dProduct
Stereotype.notes: Output generated by the business. The business product of the execution of a process.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Product.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the Product.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dSystem
Stereotype.notes: A system configuration. Settings are modeled as attributes with default values

Tag.name: config
Tag.description: The configuration file where the settings will be placed.

Tag.name: plattform
Tag.description: The plattform to which the configuration settings apply.

Stereotype.name: dNode
Stereotype.notes: A Node type used in Chronos. Nodes and Values define the application data model

Tag.name: child_order
Tag.description: The order of the associated children e.g. for Recipe: Image|Info|AdminInfo

Tag.name: display_value
Tag.description: The display value of a node e.g. for Recipe: name|AdminInfo/status|Info/status

Tag.name: initparams
Tag.description: The configuration section that is used on initialization of the corresponding mapper.

Tag.name: is_searchable
Tag.description: Indicates wether this type should be included in the default search.

Tag.name: is_soap
Tag.description: Indicates wether a SOAP interface should be generated for this type.

Tag.name: orderby
Tag.description: Definition of default sorting. Possible values: 'none' (no order), 'sortkey' (generates a 'sortkey' column, that is used for explicit sorting) or any the name of any ChiValue defined in the node optionally followed by [ASC|DESC] e.g. 'name ASC'

Tag.name: parent_order
Tag.description: The order of the associated parents.

Tag.name: pk_name
Tag.description: The name of the primary key column. The generator will add this if there is no appropriate attribute.

Tag.name: table_name
Tag.description: The name of the database table. If not given the name will be taken.

Stereotype.name: dGrowthPackage
Stereotype.notes: A set of actions identified to achieve one or more objectives for the business. A work package can be a part of a project, a complete project, or a program.

Stereotype.name: dBusinessUseCase
Stereotype.notes: A Business Use Case is part of a business process that produces an advantage to the enterprise.

Tag.name: GoalInContext
Tag.description: The goal should implicitly express the actor's intent or purpose of the use case, such as "Enrol Student in Seminar."

Tag.name: Precondition
Tag.description: A list of the conditions, if any, that must be met before a use case may be invoked. Can be a previous Use case or self the presence of the system in Scope.

Tag.name: Trigger
Tag.description: Event that is responsible for invocation of the use case.

Tag.name: Scope
Tag.description: Boundaries in which the use case is operated when invoked (E.g. CMS)

Tag.name: Level
Tag.description: Authorizations for operations/actions to be performed against the Chi business objects in scope. Against every object/process 4 CRUD basic operations are possible: Create (Write) Read (Open) Update (Change) Delete (Destroy)

Tag.name: PrimaryActor
Tag.description: the main actor of this use case

Tag.name: OtherActors
Tag.description: The list of actors associated with the use case. Although this information is contained in the use case itself, it helps to increase the understandability of the use case when the diagram is unavailable.

Tag.name: Stakeholders
Tag.description: List of actors that have a special interest (i.e. to be informed every time) in completion of the use case

Tag.name: MainSuccessScenario
Tag.description: The main path of logic an actor follows through a use case. Often referred to as the "happy path" or the "main path" because it describes how the use case works when everything works as it normally should.

Stereotype.name: dBusinessUseCaseCore
Stereotype.notes: A Core Use Case generates a value for an active business partner and is directly connected to the objectives (Goals) of a company or the process of his existence (typically making money).

Stereotype.name: dRequirement
Stereotype.notes: A Business guide line about the Enterprise or the project.

Tag.name: Author
Tag.description: This requirement's author's name and role in the project

Tag.name: Priority
Tag.description: A priority in %. Requirements are ordered by priority.

Tag.name: Proofreader
Tag.description: Each requirement needs to be confirmed. This requirement's proofreader 's name and role in the project

Tag.name: Type
Tag.description: The type of requirement.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the requirement.

Stereotype.name: dAccord
Stereotype.notes: Agreement made for an architecture entity.

Stereotype.name: dCapability
Stereotype.notes: A business outcome that is current available in an Organization Unit (or) A business-focused outcome that is delivered by the completion of one or more work packages.

Tag.name: BusinessValue
Tag.description: Describes how this capability provides value to the enterprise.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization for Capability

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Capability

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the architecture entity.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Tag.name: IncrementVertical
Tag.description: The maturity level of your vertical (the industry)

Tag.name: IncrementSupplyChain
Tag.description: The maturity level of your supply chain (Partners)

Tag.name: Increments
Tag.description: Current (AS-IS) maturity level for the entity.

Tag.name: IncrementsToBe
Tag.description: Future (To-Be) maturity level for the entity.

Stereotype.name: dController
Stereotype.notes: A Controller type used in Chronos. Controller, Views and Associations define the application flow

Stereotype.name: dDataEntity
Stereotype.notes: An encapsulation of data that is recognized by a business domain expert as a thing. Logical data entities can be tied to applications, repositories, and services and may be structured according to implementation considerations.

Tag.name: PrivacyClassification
Tag.description: Level of restriction placed on access to the data.

Tag.name: RetentionClassification
Tag.description: Level of retention to be placed on the data.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Data Entity.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the Data Entity.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dDiscord
Stereotype.notes: A disagreement made for architecture entity.

Stereotype.name: dFeature
Stereotype.notes: A distinguishing characteristic of a software item

Tag.name: Author
Tag.description: This feature's author's name and role in the project

Tag.name: Proofreader
Tag.description: This feature's revisor's name and role in the project

Tag.name: Status
Tag.description: This feature's status

Stereotype.name: dGoal
Stereotype.notes: a Measurable scope that the enterprise wants to achieve.

Tag.name: Priority
Tag.description: A priority in %

Tag.name: Value_amount
Tag.description: The actual amount of the value this goal intends to alter

Tag.name: Value_Goal
Tag.description: The amount by which the value is to be altered

Tag.name: Value_Name
Tag.description: The name of the value this goal intends to alter

Tag.name: dAssumption
Tag.description: The assumptions made to achieve the goal.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Goal.

Stereotype.name: dIssue
Stereotype.notes: The problems that are affecting a business, or the problems which are creating the largest negative impact.

Tag.name: Author
Tag.description: This issue's author's name and role in the project

Tag.name: Responsible
Tag.description: The responsible to close the present issue

Stereotype.name: dMeasurementArea
Stereotype.notes: The organisation or Business units performance objective is captured as measurement area.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Measurement Area.

Tag.name: Definition
Tag.description: Definition of the Measurement Area.

Stereotype.name: dMeasurementCategory
Stereotype.notes: The category to be measured under a measurement area.

Tag.name: MeasurementArea
Tag.description: The reference Measurement Area to which this category belongs to.

Tag.name: Definition
Tag.description: Definition of the measurement category.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Measurement Category.

Stereotype.name: dMeasurementGrouping
Stereotype.notes: Categorization of measurement indicators into various groups under a measurement category.

Tag.name: MeasurementCategory
Tag.description: Related Measurement Category to which the group belongs to.

Tag.name: Definition
Tag.description: Definition of the Measurement Grouping.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Measurement Grouping.

Stereotype.name: dMeasurementIndicator
Stereotype.notes: The specific measure captured for a Organization or Business Unit which can be measured and quantifiable.

Tag.name: MeasurementGrouping
Tag.description: The related Measurement Group to which the indicator belongs to.

Tag.name: UnitOfMeasure
Tag.description: The unit of measure (if available) for the Measurement Indicator.

Tag.name: SatisfactionLevel
Tag.description: Satisfaction level for the Measurement Indicator

Tag.name: Definition
Tag.description: Definition of the Measurement Indicator.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Measurement Indicator.

Stereotype.name: dObject
Stereotype.notes: An Object is a candidate for a Node repppresented in an activity diagram

Stereotype.name: dObjective
Stereotype.notes: A time-bounded milestone for an organization used to demonstrate progress towards a goal.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Objective.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner for the Objective.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dOpinion
Stereotype.notes: A view or judgement formed about an architecture entity.

Stereotype.name: dOpinionInner
Stereotype.notes: A specialized opinion created by internal team.

Stereotype.name: dPrinciple
Stereotype.notes: A qualitative statement of intent that should be met by the architecture. Has at least a supporting rationale and a measure of importance.

Tag.name: Implications
Tag.description: Statement of what the principle means in practical terms.

Tag.name: MeasurementIndicator
Tag.description: Identifies mechanisms that will be used to measure whether the principle has been met or not.

Tag.name: Priority
Tag.description: Priority of this principle relative to other principles.

Tag.name: Rationale
Tag.description: Statement of why the principle is required and the outcome to be reached.

Tag.name: Statement
Tag.description: Statement of what the principle is.

Tag.name: Type
Tag.description: The category of the principle.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner for the Principle

Tag.name: PrincipleID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Principle expressed as text.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dView
Stereotype.notes: A View used in Chronos. Controller, Views and Associations define the application flow

Stereotype.name: dDecision
Stereotype.notes: A decision-making step with accompanying decision logic used to determine execution approach for a process or to ensure that a process complies with governance criteria.

Tag.name: Subject Area
Tag.description: Area of Concern

Tag.name: Topic
Tag.description: Topic of Interest

Tag.name: Issue
Tag.description: A short description of the problemwhat is being decided

Tag.name: Assumptions
Tag.description: What is believed to be true about the context of the problem, constraints on the solution.

Tag.name: Motivation
Tag.description: Why this decision is important.

Tag.name: Alternatives
Tag.description: A list of alternatives and explanations

Tag.name: Decision
Tag.description: The decision taken, possibly with references to related work products

Tag.name: Justification
Tag.description: Why the decision was made and a list of compliance to Architecture Principles and explanations of deviations from compliance

Tag.name: Implications
Tag.description: What impact the decision will have

Tag.name: RelatedDecisions
Tag.description: A list of related decisions

Stereotype.name: dManyToMany
Stereotype.notes: A many to many node used in Chronos. It is used to realize a many to many relation between two Nodes.

Stereotype.name: dValue
Stereotype.notes: A Node value type used in Chronos. These values are persistent

Tag.name: app_data_type
Tag.description: The datatype used in the application e.g. DATATYPE_DONTCARE, DATATYPE_ATTRIBUTE, DATATYPE_ELEMENT or DATATYPE_IGNORE

Tag.name: db_data_type
Tag.description: The datatype used in the database

Tag.name: is_editable
Tag.description: Whether the attribute is editable or not

Tag.name: input_type
Tag.description: The HTML input type for the attribute e.g. select#fix:key1[val1]|key2[val2]

Tag.name: display_type
Tag.description: The HTML display type for the attribute e.g. image

Tag.name: restrictions_match
Tag.description: A regular expression that the value must match (e.g. '[0-3][0-9]\.[0-1][0-9]\.[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9]' for date values)

Tag.name: restrictions_not_match
Tag.description: A regular expression that the value must NOT match

Tag.name: restrictions_description
Tag.description: A text describing the restrictions

Tag.name: column_name
Tag.description: The name of the database column. If not given the name will be taken

Stereotype.name: dLocation
Stereotype.notes: A place where business activity takes place and can be hierarchically decomposed.

Tag.name: AreaCode
Tag.description: The area code of the Location.

Tag.name: City
Tag.description: The City of the Location.

Tag.name: Country
Tag.description: The City of the Location.

Tag.name: EmailID
Tag.description: The contact e-mail Id for the Location.

Tag.name: PhoneNumber
Tag.description: The contact phone number for the Location.

Tag.name: Province
Tag.description: The Province of the Location.

Tag.name: Street
Tag.description: The street part of the Location.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Location

Stereotype.name: dStakeHolder
Stereotype.notes: Any person or force that have an interest in the considered domain.

Tag.name: Power
Tag.description: the measure of the possibilities in context that this person has to realiza his objectives.

Tag.name: Role
Tag.description: The official role that this stakeholder play in context.

Stereotype.name: dBusinessPartner
Stereotype.notes: A BusinesPartner is an external person that has a Business relation with the enterprise.

Stereotype.name: dWorker
Stereotype.notes: A Worker is a special actor that works within the enterprise.

Stereotype.name: dActor
Stereotype.notes: The actor entity used for representing a User, System, Stakeholder or Partner.

Tag.name: #FTEs
Tag.description: Estimated number of FTEs that operate as this Actor.

Tag.name: ActorGoal
Tag.description: Objectives that this actor has, in general terms.

Tag.name: ActorTasks
Tag.description: Tasks that this actor performs, in general terms.

Stereotype.name: dOrganizationUnit
Stereotype.notes: A self-contained unit of resources with line management responsibility, goals, objectives, and measures. Organizations may include external parties and business partner organizations.

Tag.name: HeadCount
Tag.description: Number of FTEs wor king within the organization.

Tag.name: PersonIncharge
Tag.description: Person in-charge of the Organization Unit will be one of the Key Stakeholders.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Organization Unit.

Stereotype.name: dRole
Stereotype.notes: The usual or expected function of an actor, or the part somebody or something plays in a particular action or event. An actor may have a number of roles.

Tag.name: #FTEs
Tag.description: Number of Full time Equivalent employees working in the Role.

Tag.name: User
Tag.description: User-definable categorization.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Role .

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the Role.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dWorkerExternal
Stereotype.notes: A External Worker is an employee that interacts directly with BusinesPartner outside the enterprise.

Stereotype.name: dWorkerInternal
Stereotype.notes: A Worker Internal is an employee of the enterprise that has no contact with Business partners.

Stereotype.name: dBusinessPartnerActive
Stereotype.notes: A BusinesPartnerActive is a direct customer of the enterprise.

Stereotype.name: dBusinessPartnerPassive
Stereotype.notes: A BusinesPartnerPassive is an indirect customer (typically a supplier) of the enterprise.
